Module entities
Package entities

Class Course

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.Course
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Course
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The course class is an entity that holds information regarding a course. A school can contain several courses whose data is stored in instances of this class. Class Attributes: - courseName : String, which is the name of the course. - courseCode : String, which is a unique code that can be used to identify the course. - schoolName : String, which is the school that the course belongs to. - au : int, which is the number of creadits alloted to the course. - courseIndex : ArrayList(Index), which is a list of indices or classes within the course. - lectures : Lesson[2], which is a list of lectures for the course, since lectures are shared by all indices. - serialVersionUID : long, needed to verify that serialization and de-serialization is done correctly
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Course

        public Course​(java.lang.String courseName,
              java.lang.String courseCode,
              java.lang.String schoolName,
              int au)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Class constructor that is used on object instantiation.
        Parameters:
        courseName - , the name of the course being created.
        courseCode - , the unique code for the course being created.
        schoolName - , the name of the school to which the course belongs.
        au - , the number of credits for the course. There are certain restrictions on the number of credits in this case. A course cannot have more than 4 or less than 1 credit.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • Method Detail

      • addCourseLecture

        public boolean addCourseLecture​(java.lang.String venue,
                                WorkingHours timings)
        addCourseLecture() can be used to add lectures to the course, since lectures are shared for all indices of the course.
        Parameters:
        venue - , the venue where the lecture will take place
        timings - , the timings for the lecture
        Returns:
        true if the lecture was added successfully. false if the lecture was not added successfully due to invalid timings, or if too many lectures already exist for the course.

      • addIndex

        public boolean addIndex​(java.lang.String indexCode,
                        java.lang.String groupName)
        addIndex() can be used to add a new index to the course.
        Parameters:
        indexCode - , which is the unique identification code for the index
        groupName - , which is the name being given to the index.
        Returns:
        true, if the index was successfully added to the course. false, if the index already exists in the course.

      • removeIndex

        public boolean removeIndex​(java.lang.String indexCode)
        removeIndex() can be used to delete a course index, using its unique identification code.
        Parameters:
        indexCode - , which is the identifier for the index being removed.
        Returns:
        true, if the index was successfully removed. false, if the index does not exist.

      • getWaitListSizes

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getWaitListSizes()
        getWaitListSizes() can be used to find the size of the waitList for each index. It uses a hashmap to store the key value pair where the key is the index code, and the value is the number of students in the index waitList.
        Returns:
        a hashmap(String, Integer) containing the number of students in the waitList for each index.

      • findIndexPos

        public int findIndexPos​(java.lang.String indexCode)
        findIndexPos() is a function used by class modifier functions when modifying an index in the course. It can be used to find the position of an index in the arrayList of indices for easy retrieval using the unique index code.
        Parameters:
        indexCode - , which is the unique identifier for an index within the course.
        Returns:
        an integer representing the position of the index in the array list thus enabling easy access to the index data. The function returns -1 if the index does not exist in this course.

      • findIndex

        public Index findIndex​(java.lang.String indexCode)
        This function is similar to findIndexPos(), but instead of returning the position of the index, it returns the index instance containing all its information.
        Parameters:
        indexCode - , which is the unique identifier for an index within the course.
        Returns:
        an Index object. Returns null if the index does not exist in the course.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
